text: Phyllis Newman (March 19, 1933 â€“ September 15, 2019) was an American actress, activist and singer. She won the 1962 Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Musical for her role as Martha Vail in the Broadway-theatre production of Subways Are for Sleeping. She was nominated twice for the Drama Desk Award. Newman was a breast cancer survivor.Listing. amazon.ca. Retrieved March 13, 2009. She died on September 15, 2019 in New York City at the age of 86.Staff (September 15, 2019) "Phyllis Newman Has Passed Away at 86" Broadway World The cause of death was lung disease-related problems. ==References== ==Other websites== * Phyllis Newman's Website * Category:Tony Award winning actors Category:1933 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from lung disease Category:Disease-related deaths in New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American autobiographers Category:American activists Category:American feminists Category:Writers from Jersey City, New Jersey Category:Singers from Jersey City, New Jersey Category:Actors from New York City Category:Singers from New York City Category:Writers from New York City Category:Actors from Jersey City, New Jersey
title: Phyllis Newman
